Query: What's an easy way to read random line from a file in Unix command line?

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_57609826: Reading lines from a file into variables in Bash
so_26410340: Reading lines from a file in a bash script
so_30517554: Read line by line from two files simultaneously in shell script
Top-3 Scripts:
so_57609826: while read

sed 1d "$FILE" | while read -r EMAIL BIRTH GROUPS SHAREDFOLDER
do
    echo "$EMAIL"
done

so_26410340: while IFS= read -r line; do
    echo "$line"
done < <(sed 's/^M$//' "$1")

so_30517554: while read range
do 
    sed -n "${range}p" file
done < <(paste -d, starting ending)

so_11902177: x=$(echo -e "a\nb\nc d e")

x=$(echo -e "a \n b\nc d e")
